author: Jacob Kirn
title: ​Blues minority owner gives $100,000 to sponsor of Scottrade Center upgrades
text: ​Blues minority owner gives $100,000 to sponsor of Scottrade Center upgrades Feb 10, 2017, 3:25pm CST Industries & Tags Jacob Kirn Digital Editor St. Louis Business Journal Share Jacob Kirn Digital Editor St. Louis Business Journal Related Content Enlarge David Steward (left) and Lewis Reed Blues minority owner David Steward, a co-founder of World Wide Technology, on Thursday gave $100,000 to Aldermanic President Lewis Reed ’s campaign committee. Reed, a mayoral candidate, is a sponsor of legislation that would give city money for Scottrade Center upgrades. David Steward (left) and Lewis Reed Steward in 2016 donated another $65,000 to Reed’s committee, Missouri Ethics Commission records show. Tom Shepherd , Reed’s chief of staff, said Reed and Steward have never had a conversation about Scottrade Center. “We only learned of his minority interest from the media,” Shepherd said. “From what we understand, it is probably a very small item in regards to his overall holdings.” Shepherd also said Reed has sacrificed about $80,000 per year in foregone earnings from a previous career to be board president. The president’s salary is about $80,000, and each alderman is allowed a taxable $4,200 expense fund. Reed and Steward “developed a relationship some years ago and Mr. Steward’s support reflects his confidence that President Reed will make a good mayor for the city of St. Louis,” Shepherd said. Through a World Wide Technology spokesperson, Steward declined to comment. A Blues spokesman did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Related Content
